title: ALARM LOG CONFIGURATION COMMAND
description:
This command allows the operator to maintain a log that contains all alarm 
state changes by enabling the logging mode and setting the severity level equal 
to or higher than the severity level that the operator is interested in.
user_level:
The command can be accessed by operators with alarm privileges, and executed by 
operators with alarm privileges.

command_parameters.name: log-sev-level
command_parameters.description: set the lowest severity level to log alarms optional parameter
values: indeterminate         : not a definite known severity level
warning               : just to inform as a warning

command_parameters.name: log-full-action
command_parameters.description: set the action if log buffer is full optional parameter
values: wrap                  : older log records are overwritten by recent ones
halt                  : logging is stopped until the log buffer is reset

command_parameters.name: non-itf-rep-sev-level
command_parameters.description: set minimum severity level to report non itf alarms optional parameter
values: indeterminate         : not a definite known severity level
warning               : just to inform as a warning

raw:
help configure alarm
ALARM LOG CONFIGURATION COMMAND
===============================

Command Description
-------------------

This command allows the operator to maintain a log that contains all alarm 
state changes by enabling the logging mode and setting the severity level equal 
to or higher than the severity level that the operator is interested in.


User Level
----------

The command can be accessed by operators with alarm privileges, and executed by 
operators with alarm privileges.

Command Syntax
--------------

The command has the following syntax:
> configure alarm log-sev-level <Alarm::alarmSeverityReport> log-full-action 
<Alarm::alarmLogFullAction> non-itf-rep-sev-level <Alarm::alarmSeverityReport>

Command Parameters
------------------

Table "Alarm Log Configuration Command" Command Parameters

Parameter                  Description

log-sev-level              set the lowest severity level to log alarms
                           optional parameter

                           Parameter type: <Alarm::alarmSeverityReport>
                           Format:
                           ( indeterminate
                           | warning
                           | minor
                           | major
                           | critical )
                           Possible values:
                           - indeterminate         : not a definite known 
severity level
                           - warning               : just to inform as a warning
                           - minor                 : not service affecting
                           - major                 : service affecting
                           - critical              : service breaking

log-full-action            set the action if log buffer is full
                           optional parameter

                           Parameter type: <Alarm::alarmLogFullAction>
                           Format:
                           ( wrap
                           | halt )
                           Possible values:
                           - wrap                  : older log records are 
overwritten by recent ones
                           - halt                  : logging is stopped until 
the log buffer is reset

non-itf-rep-sev-level      set minimum severity level to report non itf alarms
                           optional parameter

                           Parameter type: <Alarm::alarmSeverityReport>
                           Format:
                           ( indeterminate
                           | warning
                           | minor
                           | major
                           | critical )
                           Possible values:
                           - indeterminate         : not a definite known 
severity level
                           - warning               : just to inform as a warning
                           - minor                 : not service affecting
                           - major                 : service affecting
                           - critical              : service breaking


DS-LIN-TEST-01:automationuser>#
